paragraphs.content: Chapter 16
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 16

paragraphs.content: Then Job answered and said,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then Job answered and said,

paragraphs.content: I have heard many such things: miserable comforters are ye all.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I have heard many such things: miserable comforters are ye all.

paragraphs.content: Shall vain words have an end? or what emboldeneth thee that thou answerest?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Shall vain words have an end? or what emboldeneth thee that thou answerest?

paragraphs.content: I also could speak as ye do: if your soul were in my soul’s stead, I could heap up words against you, and shake mine head at you.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I also could speak as ye do: if your soul were in my soul’s stead, I could heap up words against you, and shake mine head at you.

paragraphs.content: But I would strengthen you with my mouth, and the moving of my lips should assuage your grief.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But I would strengthen you with my mouth, and the moving of my lips should assuage your grief.

paragraphs.content: Though I speak, my grief is not assuaged: and though I forbear, what am I eased?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Though I speak, my grief is not assuaged: and though I forbear, what am I eased?

paragraphs.content: But now he hath made me weary: thou hast made desolate all my company.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But now he hath made me weary: thou hast made desolate all my company.

paragraphs.content: And thou hast filled me with wrinkles, which is a witness against me: and my leanness rising up in me beareth witness to my face.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And thou hast filled me with wrinkles, which is a witness against me: and my leanness rising up in me beareth witness to my face.

paragraphs.content: He teareth me in his wrath, who hateth me: he gnasheth upon me with his teeth; mine enemy sharpeneth his eyes upon me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He teareth me in his wrath, who hateth me: he gnasheth upon me with his teeth; mine enemy sharpeneth his eyes upon me.

paragraphs.content: They have gaped upon me with their mouth; they have smitten me upon the cheek reproachfully; they have gathered themselves together against me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They have gaped upon me with their mouth; they have smitten me upon the cheek reproachfully; they have gathered themselves together against me.

paragraphs.content: God hath delivered me to the ungodly, and turned me over into the hands of the wicked.
paragraphs.contentHtml: God hath delivered me to the ungodly, and turned me over into the hands of the wicked.

paragraphs.content: I was at ease, but he hath broken me asunder: he hath also taken me by my neck, and shaken me to pieces, and set me up for his mark.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I was at ease, but he hath broken me asunder: he hath also taken me by my neck, and shaken me to pieces, and set me up for his mark.

paragraphs.content: His archers compass me round about, he cleaveth my reins asunder, and doth not spare; he poureth out my gall upon the ground.
paragraphs.contentHtml: His archers compass me round about, he cleaveth my reins asunder, and doth not spare; he poureth out my gall upon the ground.

paragraphs.content: He breaketh me with breach upon breach, he runneth upon me like a giant.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He breaketh me with breach upon breach, he runneth upon me like a giant.

paragraphs.content: I have sewed sackcloth upon my skin, and defiled my horn in the dust.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I have sewed sackcloth upon my skin, and defiled my horn in the dust.

paragraphs.content: My face is foul with weeping, and on my eyelids is the shadow of death;
paragraphs.contentHtml: My face is foul with weeping, and on my eyelids is the shadow of death;

paragraphs.content: Not for any injustice in mine hands: also my prayer is pure.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Not for any injustice in mine hands: also my prayer is pure.

paragraphs.content: O earth, cover not thou my blood, and let my cry have no place.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O earth, cover not thou my blood, and let my cry have no place.

paragraphs.content: Also now, behold, my witness is in heaven, and my record is on high.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Also now, behold, my witness is in heaven, and my record is on high.

paragraphs.content: My friends scorn me: but mine eye poureth out tears unto God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My friends scorn me: but mine eye poureth out tears unto God.

paragraphs.content: O that one might plead for a man with God, as a man pleadeth for his neighbour!
paragraphs.contentHtml: O that one might plead for a man with God, as a man pleadeth for his neighbour!

paragraphs.content: When a few years are come, then I shall go the way whence I shall not return.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When a few years are come, then I shall go the way whence I shall not return.
